OOC: Yikes, a few months ago, when I had a 6 bot gestalt, I was accused of
moding by Unitron (No offene) for breaking the giant bot rule. Ouch.

BIC: Shokaract was covered with a cloud of smoke. The smoke clears.
Shokaract is still standing, he looks up at WarMachine, the horns on pne
side of his head dangling.

Shokaract: Uhh, you do not know my power.

Shokaract had been charging some negative energy to use through the Matrix
of Conquest, and he decided now was the time to use it. It had the power to
make one large blast be the power of 10 Large blasts, but he could only use
one before having to recharge. Shokaract pulls the energy into his hands,
making him glow and making rocks around him melt as they were caught in it.
He fired the single blast, it moved very quickly towards WarMachine,
Shokaract intending them to split apart again...
----- Original Message -----
From: <Yanshosh@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, October 26, 2000 4:23 PM
Subject: Re: War


> He might be big, yes, but there is very little chance he could be as
> big as WarMachine. Tripredacus was only three bots, WarMachine is
> five. Besides, Rampage was 12 feet tall. If you're saying Shockaract
> is that high, he'd be about four times as small as WarMachine (who's
> over 45 feet tall). If you want Shockaract to be nearly as bit (even
> not nearly as big, say 20 feet), that would be breaking the giant bot
> rule. Gestalts are giant, but they're five bots, not one, and were
> aprooved back in March or April.
>
> ::WarMachine::
>
> WarMachine laughs, bringing up an arm to absorb the shot.
>
> "You can't hope to defeat me, fool!" he yells, firing from his
> shoulder missile launchers at Shockaract, several dozen machine gun
> shots accompanying the two missiles.
>
>
>
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "THECODE" <thecode@p...> wrote:
